czEQSI8fBFVJo4kFDBLTOQ.text: Absolutly the best fish and chips i had in London. I tried a few more "famous" places, none compared.

QKZVKzJIFiQjB43_2PD2Ug.text: Not the best fish and chips I've had, but not the worst either. They were quite crispy which was great. The drawback for me was the skin was left on. Ew. And it came off and stuck to the inside of my mouth. Very gross. Not sure if that is how they are all the time or if it was just a bad piece. Also, when I went, on a Friday night the sitting area was closed. So it was take away only. I didn't ask why, but maybe call first if you want to sit down.

29jH7ACKKc-AboNi22B5dg.text: Although it has great perfectly crispy fish, the chips are craving for the same crispness of the fish batter. Service could be friendlier. Beer is great. Fish and the chips could be slightly saltier. Good place for groups and kids.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. Top floor with nice natural light.

rauMBinYvCIuQRuRkEzK0g.text: The restaurant is not too fancy.  But it was very clean with  plenty of seating.  The waiter was very friendly and the fish and chips were absolutely delicious.  The best lunch in London so far and for less than $9 a person.

LKOPwRG7Q3pMjeVHwuwWCw.text: The fish was nicely done - moist on the inside and crispy out the outside. We had a large order of cod and it was more than enough to share between two people. Chips on the other hand, was less than perfect. Luck of the draw, maybe?

6PlishSuxEudt7Gq4-G4Bg.text: The fish and chips was good. Cute little place. Seating upstairs and the bathroom is in the basement which kinda sucks after a long day of wandering. Our server was pretty rude and a little mean.

6pa8g5dhTLhLAPOc6RryuA.text: Our first fish & chips while staying in London. Delicious! Lightly battered, crispy & tasty. I ordered the haddock while my husband ordered the cod - both were well fried and didn't disappoint. You have the option of dining upstairs in their actual dining room, or you could grab a couple of the window seats by the front of the store. Portions are relatively large, so be forewarned! Oh, and they don't take Amex. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. Regular sized fried haddock w/ chips.

LAVqaHDY14wgB4eCtj6o7A.text: I came across this place while walking to the underground hungry. It looked nice and they have an emphasis on sustainable fishing - which is great.We ordered the chicken pie and small cod. The pie was clearly made, not bought and was almost perfect. The pastry wasn't overwhelming and the pie had a nice mushroom and chicken taste. My only comment would be that there needs to be more chicken bits.The cod was nice and was cooked just right rather than too long. The small size is quite generous so many might find it suitable for a lunch rather than being tempted to order a larger one.The chips, are perhaps the best thing about this place. Perfectly cooked so they are crispy but not greasy. They tasted great!! Wish I could eat chips like this more often.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. Upper level
Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. Delicious chips
Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. Small cod

DraNaoC-bR8NANo4-M_TPw.text: POOR Service and Average foodPros:CleanModern and quaint decor Fresh fishCons:Inconsistent and extremely slow service:-(Average foodFood ordered: Fish and chips-the fish was lightly battered and bland, no salt or flavor whatsoever. Chips were fried well. I would not recommend it to anyone.  Oak Smoked Salmon- very tastyService: Our server Yana greeted us with a slice of bread (no introduction), then she did not return to the table for quite some time. The hostess noticed and took our order. Our meal took an extremely long time to be served. So long, a couple that was seated 15-20 mins after us received their meal at the same time. I mentioned this to the manager and he offered to comp our appetizer and give us a free dessert. That was wonderful, but the service continued on its downward slide. I'll take excellent service over FREE food any day! We finished our meal and our server did not come to clear our table and offer a dessert menu for some time. She finally made her way to our table cleared it and a short while later the manager came and took our dessert order. We ate our dessert and sat around waiting again for the check. I placed my credit card on the table as a hint I was ready to pay and still no sign of our server. I finally made eye contact with her and she dropped the bill on the table and walked away(I honestly wanted to cry at this point) I waited a while then walked to the hostess and paid my bill.This was a very frustrating and unfulfilling dining experience. I will never return nor recommend this place. I'm not sure what the disconnect was between my server of whom I did not know her name or that she was indeed my server until I was leaving the restaurant was.  But she was HORRIBLE to my mom and I and does not deserve to work in the service industry!

cKMP1U2c42Y3QF0Uu7OHKw.text: The best i've tried so far~ After a a long walk from the Westborne park area down Portobello Market my friend and I were starving.. He was visiting from Germany and wanted to eat Fish & Chips.. i was not familiar with the area so i hit up google...and this place was on the top 5 places for Fish & Chips and we were right in front of it. So decided not to venture far...and ever since then i've been a total fan and this is where i take all my friends. It's not cheap...but the quality of food is great in my opinion. What i like: 1. FOOD FOOD FOOD-the batter is crispy and the fish is flaky & fresh2. Ambiance- very cute & clean cottage on the beach feel. 3. Staff is SUPER friendly and cool. And very helpful for suggestions.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. One of my favorite places~
Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. salt and pepper calamari is really yummy and you just can't stop eating them~!
Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. We ordered the whole set: Fish & Chips + mushy peas + gherkin + onions. It was DELISH!

fI7HJ-bAAeWsvDCfSZn_Mg.text: Just came here for a casual lunch on a Sunday afternoon. The street was crowded as it is the weekend and all the shops are open. Upon walking the staff was very friendly to me and seated me upstairs. I ordered the salmon sole, a drink (dandelion and burdock) and a custard dessert of the day. My drink came right away, I was willing to try a new drink and he waitor had suggested it tastes very similar to coke. I gave it a try, it has some herbs in it and it tastes healthy and carbonated. I had to ask for ice later on as my drink was no long chilled and it doesn't taste the same when it's not cold. (£2.95 for the drink)The salmon and sole was (£13.95) it came really deep fried, a large portion. I could not finish the chips or the fish. Personally it was too fried for me and very bland - they do have salt and pepper on tables tho! It wa so fried that I was able to seperate the fish from the fried batter very very easily. The chips was great! It was moist and not too crunchy. I loved them but I couldn't finish the plate as it was too large of a portion. They have placemats and they were informative by telling guests where the fish is from (Norway) and the potatoes from Essex. I ended the meal with a pudding dessert which was way too sweet for me. I was hoping for a custard instead I got a sponge cake type dessert. The service here is very slow. THere is only 1 waitor working the top floor (where most the seats are). It took me at least 15 minutes to ask for my dessert and waited another 10 minutes for it to come. Once I was done wih everything it took another 10 minutes to get his attention as get the bill.It was a good experience but I probably would not be coming again since it was slow and the fish was personally too deep fried for me.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. Salmon sole (13.5)
Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. Pudding of the day (5)

Uxh9xjI64n7apo4QzFJ8qw.text: This place is really good!  The customer service was outstanding.  My sister and I were waiting on our take out order of fish cake, and the guy behind the counter offered us a fish bite sample.  When he handed us our order, we got our fish cakes, more fish bites and some chips!  He also suggested us to try the tartar sauce which was really good.  The fish and the chips were awesome!  This place is a must try.

pwDg7iJ9juocNvMC4Tybtw.text: I'm not typically one for fried food - and I'm totally horrified by the amount we consumed in London - that all said, holy deliciousness. The Fish House was exceptionally delicious. The Fish House is what is in terms of service and atmosphere, it's a Notting Hill chippy, and it was so excellent. I had the lemon sole - a regret only because it was so flipping big - and Adam had, and devoured, the cod. I was so grateful to find a chippy that offered more than just cod - and sole at that! Delicious, well priced, and not slow when as busy as it was.

bKnzf0SE0MnhHykdcDeV1g.text: Stopped by here with my family while on vacation in London. The restaurant was clean and nicely decorated. We ordered the haddock and chips and the seafood platter appetizer. The haddock was juicy and perfectly fried. Nothing special with the chips. The seafood platter was good but it was a little greasy compared to the fish. On the table, there are various condiments that you can use which was nice to have. Decent place for fish and chip.

VPwCh9L7R9FgZZoXegmfZQ.text: Loved it!  Fast and friendly service.   Food came out very quickly (5 minutes?  Maybe not even).  Had the small cod which was steaming and flakey fresh.  The food was slightly on the bland side (for us Americans), which I prefer.  Fish sourced from Norway and potatoes from a family run farm in Essex. Would def come back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. Small cod fish and chips

w6Obw0_luHx7EMxScTS3-A.text: Wonderful - was a pleasant experience and atmosphere was nice. Wait staff were attentive and polite. Would recommend this place to anyone visiting.

GEzo5fu-L1_tYE15iUvGaQ.text: It's almost too good to be true. Plump fresh haddock and cod fillets with crispy fries. Service is fast. Just seating for 2-3 but worth the sacrifice in comfort for truly remarkable fish.

-dwuzLL7mo0MYjOo8uStLg.text: Great fish and chips! They have a take away counter on the main level, but just upstairs are tables and chairs for dining in. The fish (which is responsibly sourced from Norway), was fresh and lightly fried, making it so light and crispy, and the chips were great too! Great sized portions, and amazing service await you at the Fish House, on a bustling street in Notting Hill close to lots of quirky shops!

EUScU7V_cYtaTbfCXGSpUA.text: We heard the sayings fish and chips in London is a touristy thing blah blah blah.  All I care about is if the fish is battered and fried well and the chips are hot and crispy.  This definitely is a cool spot it has the upstairs dining area that kinda feels like you are in a pseudo seaside diner because of the white paint, wooden table and sea blue paneling color scheme.  I ordered the large haddock with chips, wifey ordered the cod with chips.  The fish and the chips were fresh out of the fryer hot, lovin' it already.  Both came with lemon and mayo tartar.  The serving portion was literally a 10 inch piece of fish, no joke.  Chips were exactly how they should be done anywhere with just the right amount of salt, crispy and mmm mmm good.  The fish was superb, the haddock from Norway had a nice cross flavor between halibut and cod with that fresh fish flesh chew.  The cod, equally superb with a wonderful flaky texture.  The batter was awesome, perfect balance of crunch, density and flavor.  Miss out on this place, shame on you.  Cheers to all who go and try.

a5tOpkvJnEIy2ADovZcuJQ.text: Definitely don't pass up a chance to eat here. Get the cod split a large to save on the extra cost of eating in instead of take out.

lh_N8yYJhzAc7q80nPHWOA.text: We live in the US and always looking for decent fish and chips when visiting London.  We found this place along the way to Portobello St Market.They have a variety of fish: cod, haddock, sole, etc.We had the regular portion (£6.75) of cod and of haddock.Both were prepared excellent....tasty and crisp, but not excessively greasy.They also have a small portion (£5.50) and a large portion (£7.75).A small order of chips (£2.50) was ok and plentiful.So among a dozen places tried....this ranks very high on the chart for the price quantity and quality.The staff was friendly and helpful too.

LlN6scqrGGDVnac3w8sHUA.text: We sought after delicious Fish and Chips in London and this place certainly did deliver that! The decor was cute and the place was clean. I ordered the regular cod and chips, it was the best I have ever had. I am sure I would have been good with the small. The tartar sauce was good, not great. The mushy peas much to my surprise were good! The service however was poor (really slow and not friendly) which is why I am not giving a 5 star rating, also the prices are higher for sitting down than taking out.

uo0VGN_1mWbF6AlFIxeKwQ.text: Delicious fish and chips. Not too overly fried tasting. Huge portions though not cheap. The wait staff was friendly and the decor was very cute. Best fish and chips I've had to date !!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom

HlBw9zTK-BPDoyJ6yw_Suw.text: Definitely the best fish and chips that I've gotten during my trip. The fish is lighly batter and made to order, so be careful since it will be hot. They have a takeout and dine in option with free wifi. The place is small so the wait may be a little long but is worth it!

O7xXXEFJW5Z1eBSuQed0iA.text: A great place for wonderful fish and chips.  Always fresh and delicious.  Friendly staff. Will go back every time I'm in London.

a4nH3_Fes8GGAFRvKavv4Q.text: Solid place.  Good service and quick food, and the food is fresh and not overly fried.  It is somewhat of a tourist clientele, possibly given the location and fact that it's fish and chips.  But definitely not a tourist trap, since the service and food here delivers in a way that will satisfy you.

9ZkKI4Qj0tt2_Xw1-UmyhA.text: Those ordering a takeaway pay significantly less than those eating in. I won't deny that a summer picnic in Hyde Park seems the ideal situation in which to enjoy the British staple of fish & chips, however, an evening winter meal calls for enjoying The Fish House's upstairs dining area, its stark white walls modestly decorated with framed photographs, the space so crowded that our waiter barely has room to move between tables. It's warm & inviting up there & the large windows facing Pembridge Road offer a very London view of double decker busses driving past. We shared an order of Crispy Fried Prawns (9 for £10.90) & the large portion of Cod & Chips (£14.50), which was more than enough for two hungry diners. Douse every flakey bite in malt vinegar & if you are so inclined, try the sharply-flavored onion condiment on the table. We were pleased with these condiments, but wished the tarter sauce tasted of more than just mayo. A heads up for those who care: skin is left on on one side of the fish, which was easy for me to avoid. Delicious, crispy chips, probably the best I had on this trip!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. Fried shrimp & chips
Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. Large cod & chips

26S5tVWf2xI5639nxuO8tA.text: Excellent fish and chips. Light and crispy batter that was thin and the regular cod portion was perfect.

kec1hq8rLnsSV94bUUjqhQ.text: Great friendly service! Food was excellent! Fish was a good decent size and a good helping of chips. Batter was tasty and crispy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom

L5LTxYTJfoOoiSmA4jRQ9g.text: Excellent breading on the fish, sausage and chicken bites. Crisp, light and delicious!!! The steak pie is undesirably savory.....highly recommend, even though the toilette is 3 floors down, it is worth it!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. The lemon sole is not just ginormous but light and delicious

VxMnD0CrmJ5xzudglDUqSQ.text: Great place for fast fish and chips!!! Love the atmosphere and staff are very attentive. Definitely can split a large between two people but may need some more fries. The cod and haddock are both good but I preferred the cod. Try it you won't be disappointed!!!

nhWc6Pwqbf-K91TiJ0ICdQ.text: My history with fish and chips dates back to my days abroad in England, marked mostly by drunk late night cravings at sketchy takeaway spots, or default meals at dark pubs. Therefore, it's refreshing to see The Fish House offer an alternative for the non-degenerate crowd - a chippy that's kitchen-tiled, clean, white-and-teal, and nautical-themed. Not to mention, they were bumpin' upbeat reggae and island beats, which just seems like pretty important info in general.The Fish House offers the same general fare as its down and dirtier brethren, though here they celebrate their responsibly sourced seafood. I got my standard order of Haddock and Chips, with a side of Mushy Peas (plus a Meantime London Lager) - and the fish was excellent. The batter was light without being puffy, crispy without being crusty - that solid-coated combo that only a well-trained, English deep-fryer can miraculously manage. So, how did we get here? After a stroll down Portobello Road, nearing the Notting Hill Gate tube stop, we weren't exactly looking for fish and chips, but man, were we glad we found it. It's not entirely surprising us tourists got sucked in here, given what it lacks in authentic digs, it manages to make up with inviting charm. The downstairs is a spick-and-span takeaway counter, while the upstairs brings you to a casual dining room overlooking some lovely London backyards. And in lieu of traditional male and female stick figures on the toilet doors, you have images of Hugh Grant and Julia Roberts, in case you forgot the neighborhood you were in and/or a certain 1999 rom-com of the same name.I forwent my typical fish and chips research prior to my recent trip to London, rightfully assuming we'd stumble in the right direction at some point. While I expected this to come in the form of greasier fare in styrofoam trays, the quality upgrade was a delicious diversion and worthy of a recommendation for those headed into town. Despite its softer appearance, The Fish House makes a mean fish and chips.

b8fTSSGHtS4X0HNkaS9fBg.text: I ordered the cod fish and chips and it was perfectly fine, nothing to write home about. I've had much better fish and chips (for MUCH less cost - why is the exact same order 4.70 pounds cheaper if ordered for takeout? I've never heard of such a thing) in the UK in the last week. Also, and I hate to be a stereotypical American here, but the service at restaurants in the UK is baffling (at least in my experience). My 8 year old son wanted a Coke and we saw several cans of them at the takeout counter when we first came in. Our waiter told us they only had Diet Coke because they only serve bottles upstairs, not cans. He said he would have to charge us 2.40 if he gave us a can. Huh? How about just giving my son what he wants and adjusting the price accordingly? Then my young daughter spilled about 70% of her drink. When he came over to clean it up, he didn't offer to bring a new one over like any waiter at any restaurant in the US would. I just find the lack of customer service at restaurants here so odd. It was especially frustrating that this place automatically included a 12% gratuity in the bill because it was not earned. Overall, not a great experience.

sthYMkSTihdTSNkAVjFE_w.text: My wife and I shared the large fish and chips (we got the cod) and it was a perfect portion for the two of us. At around £16.50 it was very reasonably priced, especially since it fed us both. Good quality fish and crispy batter (not greasy) made it a very enjoyable experience for us who were looking for a proper fish and chips experience while in London.

5QpacNJ9kq9x3TGnTDUjng.text: I'd been craving good old fashioned Northern grub for so long and was half debating dropping everything and hot footing it north and then.... Der der deeeeer.. I found this little him of a chippy in Notting Hill!! Yippeeee! I went for a small chips which were put in a lovely cone to make it easy for eating and also to let the salt and vinegar trickle down!!! Yes they know! The finishing touch was that they were wrapped in newspaper..: Awww cuteness! The chips were fat and juicy, exactly how good chips should be! The servers are really friendly and not afraid to have a bit of banter! Woop! Seriously, if you're in Notting Hill, you gotta check this place!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. Chips in newspaper

edziYq_xQ_bkllPjRdLbHQ.text: Excellent fish and chips with huge portions in the Notting Hill area .  Main eating area upstairs.  Nice and clean informal eating area.  I will comeback for more!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. Great fish and chips.  We got some mushy peas on the side
Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. Small street front

TOt6dO8rWK-mZwTUczhlNA.text: Large portions, decent prices, very good food.  I had the haddock, my wife the cod, both were very good as were the chips.  Definitely recommend!

v2GSl16Kl5AjO-JeQLk6iw.text: Absolutely love this place. We were in London for 1 week and it was recommended to us to try it out and we've been twice. The staff is very friendly and the fish and chips if delicious. I'm from cape cod MA and have had many many fish and chips and this was one of my favorites. Highly recommend visiting here.

91s6CnnADiHwHDC_itymnw.text: We came Hungary and left very happy :) that's usually a good sign..Joking aside we loved staff and the food. Everything was good. Try 2nd floor restaurant for relax experience

-bD51nMFAUXlrzkhKBwyDg.text: My husband and I enjoyed this restaurant twice while we were in London on vacation.This is an exceptional restaurant.  If your visiting London you should consider going to this quaint restaurant.

W4IxgUkawUS68HUQ5RitEw.text: The best fish and chips I've ever had. We ordered 3 kinds of fish for 4 people. The lemon sole, cod and the haddock. Our favorite was the lemon sole, 2nd was the cod and then the haddock. All of the fish were fresh. I'd also like to thank, Stefano for being the best waiter we've had in London. he did everything from taking our order to cleaning off the table. He was very attentive friendly and a one man show. I highly recommend the fish house for fish and chips

Ww58PIOQEbTVl5XkiJxKlA.text: This place is the real deal!!!So delicious and amazing! I ordered the haddock and chips and it was so flavorful and delicious.I also ordered the meat pie to go and that was a smash.This is the place I started dreaming about! Can't wait to visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. Haddock and chips

uHB4rQ-P4-UtX4Xl7Icv8w.text: Nice atmosphere, simple and to the point. Very delicious food. definitely I am going back there!

4eExk72sXtzI6Cmh2YwlQw.text: Exactly the Fish and Chips is amazingly crispy and juicy. Also with the beer was much more good XD The spaces seems like not large enough, but I could take a enough time because the time may be earlier dinner time luckily.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. Cod's Fish & Chips

-GPgr5WzTh6IZEfA9jjiTw.text: Cozy place for family and friends. On a cold night it's a haven for eating sizzling hot fish. Highly recommended.

R2ERWJqSLio1axnzqXWcLQ.text: We had takeout downstairs. This is the best fish and chips of our UK trip! Super friendly service. The chicken pot pie and the battered sausage also tastes great!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom

h04roqY5__m7VFb6pJGpWw.text: I loved the Fish House of Notting Hill. Order the Fish & Chips with pickled onion & gherkin on the side. They go perfectly together. The chips are thick & crispy on the outside and soft in the middle. I seen a lot of people complaining about them being bland. I disagree. Very tasty to me. You can always add a little salt. Get the pudding of the day. It's simple, yet so delicious. I highly enjoyed that. Mine was chocolate and the middle was all melty & oozing chocolate, like a molten lava cake. I was in heaven. I seen a lot of reviews saying they charge extra to sit in. ALLLL places in England charge extra to sit in. It's a service charge. Basically, their TIP. We Americans tip anyways, so that's nothing that is so upsetting to us. You're supposed to tip. Service was very friendly. I knocked one star off for being a little pricey. I ordered the regular which was £14.50 which converts to 19 US , but again .. that's regular for England.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. Regular Size Fish & Chips w/side Gherkin & pickled Onion.. Great Place
Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. Pudding of the day w/ Custard. LOVED.

KxHnF1m1hwEry433OPxT8Q.text: Take away is much cheaper.The waiter who welcomed us kind, but the one who served us seemed to rush a lot and didn't seem very pleased to serve us. The small cod and chips came with a surprisingly decent portion of fish. The tartare sauce was pretty good. The chips were eh. Pass, I've had better chips. I really liked how the outside of the fish was so crispy, and stayed crispy. Unfortunately, the fish itself was flavorless, which is due to the fish itself likely. But I didn't think this meal was too enjoyable for my taste.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom

CH2po0Z3-eijw0ANd0psSg.text: This was the 2nd best fish and chips I had in the UKSo I rate my fish and chips on several things, Flavor of breading, freshness, texture of chips, and price. This place got everything right they were just a bit pricier than another place I tried in Lincolnshire. I really liked this place. I ate here 3 times before heading back to the US. I had a lots of fish and chips while in the UK and (like most British food) the fish breading is usually pretty bland so to find a place where you don't have to add salt is worth another try and a good review. Defiantly would recommend. The staff is also very nice. A couple of Italian or French guys who know their fish.

df9YBVU9MR51MNSjD88dXg.text: This chip shop seems to come out of nowhere but it was the perfect place for my sister, cousin, and I to take a break from perusing on Portobello road. I had the shrimp scampi and it tasted fresh and delicious! We were there on a Saturday afternoon in late May and we were seated straight away with a view of the street below.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom

gLsXbpGAdaPCXC9s9tCMjg.text: The Fish House of Notting Hill was a definite winner on our first dinner in London. Walking right inside before we got seated upstairs and I could already smell fresh fish in their kitchen and I knew right then we were in for something really good. After a ten hour flight I was in the mood for something filling. So I ordered the "British Beef 6 oz. Gourmet Burger with bacon & cheese" (10.50 GBP). Since the beef patty is 6 oz. it truly was a tasty burger. The layer of bacon gave it a little salted taste and the bread roll bun was soft. I did like the melted cheese in between. It was a well rounded burger that included fresh cut chips. For Fish & Chips we ordered it in the "Cod" option. In regular size (14.50 GBP). Once it was served I could already see its batter and it looked mighty good. On my first bite it does have a flaky texture, and it didn't taste fishy at all, so it wasn't too crazy. It was melt in your mouth goodness, that I could definitely get into. The tartar sauce tasted simple and gave it a good mayonnaise flavor. The malted vinegar as condiments was of course the icing on the cake. Prior to the visit I don't eat seafood of any kind and to have their Fish & Chips experience it was exceptional. I went with the traditional "Meantime London Pale Ale" (3.95 GBP). This beer tasted mildly citrusy with a little bitter at the end. Overall, it paired with our meals quite well. We got friendly service here. The simple easy to read menus was great, and dining in was comfortable making the experience well worth it to enjoy Fish House's delicious Fish & Chips.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. Located in Notting Hill
Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. Kids size meal 4 piece Cod Fillet Bites (5.50 GBP).

682FmZqwvdw_M8PuW3tlIg.text: When in the UK, get fish and chips... right?This was a solid choice (although arguably I had better in SF. Codmother's is one of my favorite just saying.)Located in Notting Hill, near the Portobello Road Market. The location was very convenient and it had a fair share of people even when it was late. There's an option of dine in and dine out. I wish that we knew that there was a difference. We just went in, there were limited seats (and all occupied), and we were told we had to take it out (which was fine.) The tartar sauce was alright. The fish was crunchy, and also had the skin in it. I don't like fish skin sooo I prefer it didn't have that. There were multiple options for fish and I believe we got the cod (most basic.) The servings was also huuuge, so we didn't finish it. Best part of it was it was very fresh, and made to order! If you're here and you wanna try fish and chips, this isn't a bad choice.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom

UQpJivbJMprkgWMnRsDiUw.text: If you want hand-breaded fish and chips, go here. No frozen, breaded pieces to be found. Take away counter staff was friendly and funny and took pride in the food quality. Breading is not too thick. It's a good ratio to the filet. Batter is made up by them throughout the day so it's fresh. A large comes with a huge amount of chips and the filet is plenty big for two people. Our new favorite place!

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom

1IH07OK9JPurrFC3FzUkGg.text: Great little place in Notting Hill. The first stop on a London stop. I had read several great reviews. I can say without doubt the best fish and chips Ive had and that includes Codfathers in SF and CodMothers in Charleston.Had take away the service was fast and Friendly. The staff was working hard as they were very busy. Don't miss!

L-7xFk2NhsZJhwFyQsx5bQ.text: Truly 5 star fish and chips of the Gods.   Flaky, fresh, crunchy fish, piping hot chips, plus the restaurant was clean and beautiful.  Great view from 2nd floor dining room, excellent service.  Would love to return again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom

KU6hpQ8ieEROObXC34IlZQ.text: Yummy, crispy and fresh. Weekend this is always busy so I recommend you go weekdays, very attentive staffs might entertain you.

qU-zWvq_V91TJZn7lKzURg.text: Great fish and chips place near notting hill.Upstairs seating available. Dining in prices a little hefty for fish and chips...add 2-3 £ to takeaway prices.My husband got the cod and I had the lemon sole, both were huge filets, fresh and tender.(Written by husband)

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. Cod & chips (large), lemon sole & chips for dine-in

tFGvYGyly2lLDACIB70_TQ.text: This is a great takeaway shop with delicious fish and chips. They subscribe to the "do one thing well" philosophy, which I appreciate. This is very near the Notting Hill tube station and a good spot for grab and go. Everything is cooked to order, so service takes a few minutes, but it was well worth it. The fish is light and flakey, the chips are crisp and salty. Portions are very generous. All in all, a great neighborhood spot!

0w_ddq06JIrvIxQt9a5PuQ.text: If you're done wandering around Notting Hill or have endured the madness of Portobello Road for too many hours and want a delicious fish n chips meal, you have found one of the best!As an American who's dealt with mediocre fried fish for most of my life, I was really happy to have found the Fish House. We split a large haddock and chips (£14.5) and that was definitely enough food for two people. The fish was probably a foot long. We also had the salt and pepper calamari, but it was very chewy and a tiny portion, so I'd skip that. Service here is very brusque, but I like that since there is often a line for lunchtime and mainly people want to eat and leave. The Fish House was my favorite fish n chips in all of London. Recommended!

itTUn76IwOBqwA6tMCJbQw.text: In comparison to many other fish and chippys, this has by far the best prepared and cooked fish. It Is always cooked to order and therefore takes a short while to appear. The chips are less so, a bit soggy, unless you ask them for well done.Young enthusiastic service. Good value relative to other offerings in the vicinity.

2-AhxOTFb-BoONVmqHSnYg.text: The fish was excellent the service was great. If you want fresh well prepared Fish and Chips this is the place to go

rdDupHFJNvzzZ1jVqJiN2A.text: The Fish and Chips are really goodI recommend the Take out and eat at the CounterCan't justify paying almost twice as much to have sit downAlso they recommended the Cod which was really goodThey are close to my Hotel so every time I come back it will be trip to this placeI used to go downtown but not worth the extra time to get there

oQytCH3mF5AP_5Z2pvjdSg.text: Long wait but well worth it. Best fish and chips our group has ever had! Cozy atmosphere and great menu selection.

ut_QEUgMyrINgqe4Gmg-6w.text: Great cod fish and chips in nice atmosphere. Side dish options were a little weird and limited which is why only 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom

5gXR_eja-C3fivQeGMHNaw.text: Fast and good service.It's mostly a fish place but you can get Burgers which I wouldn't recommend the cheese it's Kraft singles.The salt and pepper calamari isAmazing

photos.caption: Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. Salt and pepper calamari so damn good
Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. When they bring u the whole thing of mayo lol
Photo of The Fish House of Notting Hill - Notting Hill, London, United Kingdom. Bacon cheeseburger
